titlestmt.titleproper:
Guide to the Paul Langland Papers
1926-2011
MSS 253
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Cassandra Brewer, 2012. Laurainne Ojo-Ohikuare, 2014.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2015-03-03T17:27-0500

did.abstract: Paul Langland is a choreographer, dancer and educator. The Paul Langland Papers contain materials related to Langland's projects, performances, teaching, and professional involvement with modern dance techniques, including Allan Wayne Work and Contact Improvisation, from the mid-1970s through 2011.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p:
Published citations should take the following form:
Identification of item, date (if known); Paul Langland Papers; MSS 253; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Collection use is subject to all copyright laws. Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the Director of Fales Library and Special Collections. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu. or call 212 998 2596.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Paul Langland is a choreographer, dancer and educator. Langland received his BFA in Sculpture and Performance from the California College of Arts and Crafts in 1973. While in California, Langland began his involvement with the Contact Improvisation dance technique, studying under its founder Steve Paxton.

After moving to New York City in the 1970s, Langland began working with choreographer and performer Meredith Monk, whose company he later joined. Langland remained a member of the Meredith Monk Vocal Ensemble until 1985.

During his time in New York City, Langland also studied closely under dancer Allan Wayne. After Wayne's death in 1978, Langland began teaching his technique, under the name "Allan Wayne Work," and continued to develop his work.

Throughout his career, Langland has performed at various notable performance spaces and with various performance groups including The House, Danspace, Dance Theater Workshop, LaMama, The Kitchen, and Franklin Furnace, among others. Langland has also held a number of fellowships and residencies, leading to performances and workshops throughout North America, Europe, Korea, Venezuela and Cuba. He is currently a master teacher at New York University's Experimental Theater Wing.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Material is arranged both chronologically and alphabetically in different series, in some cases to retain the original organization.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The Paul Langland Papers contain material created and collected by Paul Langland during the course of his career as a choreographer, dancer and educator. The collection documents his performance and teaching of contemporary dance techniques, including Allan Wayne Work (for which Langland is a main developer) and Contact Improvisation. There is also documentation of Langland's personal works, as well as his contributions to various dance ensembles, with a focus on those located in New York City.

Material includes choreography notes, journals, artist and project files, flyers, programs, posters, and records related to Langland's tenure as a professor at New York University's Tisch School of the Arts. Additionally, the collection includes photographs documenting Langland's projects, tours, and personal life. Also included in the collection are original video and film recordings of Langland's performances.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.
Audiotapes have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: In October 2014, two boxes of duplicate or commercially released video material was de-accessioned. There are no longer boxes 40 and 41. At this time, Video Subseries A: Access Copes was altered to read Video Elements. Access copies are to be requested by the source material ID number.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series I consists of files kept by Paul Langland on various performances, artists and subjects. It includes correspondence, artist's files, programs and promotional material, press, interviews, and production information. Additionally, it includes choreography notes both for Langland's personal performances and original choreography, as well as performances associated with his position in NYU's Experimental Theater Wing. Much of the material is related to Paul Langland's involvement in the developement, teaching and performance of the "Allan Wayne Work" and Contact Improvisation dance techniques. This largely includes class notes and information on workshops and conferences, as well as information on various fellowships and residencies held by Paul Langland.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Series I is arranged alphabetically by folder title. Titles are original unless otherwise noted.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Series II is arranged chronologically within each type of material. Notebooks are dated by the earliest date included.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series II consists of personal notebooks and planners. They include personal information as well as information related to Paul Langland's choreography and

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series III consists of both dance related and personal photographs. The majority of the photographs document Paul Langand's tours with various dance ensembles, most notably with Meredith Monk's company. It includes many photographs of dance performances and events, as well as some promotional photographs for individual pieces. It also includes personal photographs that document New York City and various vacations.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Series III is arranged chronologically by the earliest date in each section. Binder 17 reflects two photo albums kepy by Paul Langland.

Series IV: Posters, Programs and Flyers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series IV consists of posters, programs, and flyers for various dance and arts performances and events. It largely consists of material related to New York City venues from the mid 1970s through the 1990s , but also includes other localities. Included in this series is material related to many notable New York City performance spaces and groups, including Danspace, Dance Theater Workshop LaMama, and Movement Research. Due to the nature of the type of material, many of the posters, programs and flyers do not include a year.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Series IV is arranged into two subseries, reflecting Paul Langland's original organization. Subseries A is arranged by artist and Subseries B is arranged by venue. Any additional material that was not assigned an original category has been arranged alphabetically by venue. This material appears at the end of the series.

did.unittitle: Meredith Monk and Ping Chong [1 of 2]
Meredith Monk and Ping Chong [2 of 2]
NYU Experimental Theater Wing/Tisch School of the Arts [1 of 2]
NYU Experimental Theater Wing/Tisch School of the Arts [2 of 2]

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series V contains both material belonging to Allan Wayne and material created by Paul Langland regarding his teaching of Allan Wayne's technique. The material belonging to Allan Wanye consists largely of dance programs featuring Wayne as a dancer. The material created by Paul Langland consists of notes and flyers regarding his classes on "Allan Wayne Work," as well as some biographical information on Allan Wayne

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The arrangement of Series V reflects Paul Langland's original arrangement of the material.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: The material in this folder seems to correspond to Tapes 1-12 in Series Vi: Video.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series VI consists largely of video recordings of Paul Langland's performances. It includes recordings of both Paul Langland's choreography as well as his performances with the Meredith Monk Company, and other dance collaborations. It includes complete recordings as well as some unedited material.
Series VI also includes three films.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Series VI is arranged chronologically. Undated material is arranged alphabetically following the dated material.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Access copies may not be available for all video material. Please consult a Fales Archivist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series VII consists of audio recordings related to Paul Langland's performances, largely of his own choreography and from his time performing with Meredith Monk's company.

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Oversize Series I is arranged alphabetically by folder title. Titles are orignial unless otherwise noted with square brackets.

did.unittitle: Edinburgh Fringe, Ricky DeMarco Student Workshop
OVERSIZE Series II: Notebooks and Planners
Black Bound Sketchbook 2: "Contact Improvisation" and "Movement Arts Class at Senior Citizens Center"
OVERSIZE Series IV: Posters, Programs and Flyers

arrangement.head: Arrangement Note
arrangement.p: Series IV is arranged into two subseries, reflecting Paul Langland's original organization. Subseries A is arranged by artist and Subseries B is arranged by venue. Any additional material that was not assigned an original category has been arranged alphabetically by venue, and is listed at the end of the series.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Oversize Series IV consists of oversize posters for various dance and arts performances and events. It largely consists of material related to New York City venues from the mid 1970s through the 1990s, but also includes other localities. Included in this series is material related to many noted New York City performance spaces and groups, including Danspace, Dance Theater Workshop, LaMama, and Movement Research. Due to the nature of the type of material, many of the posters do not include a year.

did.unittitle: NYU Experimental Theater Wing/Tisch School of the Arts

OVERSIZE Series V: Allan Wayne Material

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Oversize Series V consists of several performance posters featuring Allan Wayne.
